name: Vanilla-Fruit Smoothie
description: Ninety percent of the time, I eat savory breakfasts. But I don’t like to impose my will on others (at least not early in the morning), so when there are guests, I tend to make smoothies. I’m a big believer in frozen fruit, especially off season; it’s much more flavorful than, say, Chilean peaches.
recipeCategory: breakfast, easy, quick, shakes and smoothies
keywords: almond milk, apple juice, frozen fruit, raw, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 2 cups soy, rice or almond milk, or silken tofu, or yogurt
1/2 cup apple or orange juice or water, or as needed
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, or a couple of slices of peeled ginger, or a little honey or maple syrup, all optional
2 cups unsweetened frozen fruit: peaches, cherries, blueberries, pineapple or just about anything else

recipeInstructions.text: Combine everything in a blender. Pulse the machine, then turn it on and purée until smooth. If you’re not getting enough action, add juice or water a little at a time until the machine gets a grip. Serve immediately.
